StringTable.Entry: Makes the Custom role deck as tall as it can be without going off-screen.
Select whether you want to use the icon pack's rendition of player numbers or the game's. May require a game restart.
Determines whether or not roles will use factional role names, meaning each faction gives each role a unique role name. Requires the Text Editor mod to customize.
Determines whether or not roles will use factional role blurbs, meaning each faction gives each role a unique role blurb. Requires the Text Editor mod to customize.
Determines whether or not factions will be displayed next to roles as if colors were off in Town of Salem 2's chat settings.

Determines whether or not the faction label within the role card will be displayed and under what conditions. Mismatch means if the role doesn't belong in the current faction. Conditional means Coven/Apocalypse = Pandora and SK/Arso/WW/Shroud = Compliance. Always and Never are self explanatory. Does not affect the Town Traitor and Recruit Labels.
Gives some modifiers a faction to display as, instead of every modifier being white.
If enabled, the Neutral Apocalypse bucket will be changed to say Random Apocalypse if Gradient Buckets is active.
Determines how saturated the names of dead players are when you know their roles. Setting to -1 effectively disables this feature.
Determines how saturated the color of a banned role is. Setting to -1 effectively disables this feature.
If enabled, buckets will make use of gradients.
Override Secondary Color for Power Roles
Determines whether or not secondary colors on factions will be overwritten with a separate Major color value when Coven Power, Town Power, Cultist, or Catalyst.
Determines whether or not Catalyst is excluded from the Major gradient set or not.
Determines whether or not Cultist is excluded from the Major gradient set or not.
Exclude Town Government Roles from Major
Determines whether or not Town Government roles (Mayor, Monarch and Pacifist) are excluded from the Major gradient set or not.
Override Secondary Color for Killing Roles

Determines whether or not secondary colors on factions will be overwritten with a separate Lethal color value when Coven Killing, Town Killing, or a Berserker. Jailor is also included if the above setting is disabled.
Determines whether or not secondary colors on factions will be overwritten with a separate Horseman color value when role is a Horseman of the Apocalypse.
Determines whether or not gradients should be vertical (like Vanilla's gradients) or horziontal (like BToS2's gradients).

Determines what color recruits will pull. Jackal means it pulls from the Jackal Secondary Color, Original Primary means it pulls from their original faction's primary color, and Original Secondary pulls from their original faction's secondary color (Major if a Major role with the setting on).
Determines whether or not the Jackal role is considered Major.
Determines whether or not the Vampire role is considered Major.
Determines which victory cinematic Town will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Coven will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Serial Killer will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Arsonist will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Werewolf will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Shroud will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Apocalypse will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Vampire will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Jackal will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Frogs will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Lions will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Hawks will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Pandora will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Compliance will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Lovers will use.
Determines which victory cinematic Wandering Souls will use. Note that this can only ever appear if a Wandering Souls Pacifist wins their Protest.
Determines which victory cinematic Egotist will use. Note that this can only ever appear if an Egotist Pacifist wins their Protest.

The selected icon will start replacing the visible icons with the images you put in. If it can't find the valid image or pack, it will be replaced by the mod's default files. May require a game restart for the in-text icons to change.\nVanilla - No pack selected.

The selected set will start replacing the current silhouettes with ones created from the images you put in. If it can't find the valid image or set, it will be replaced by the mod's default files.\nVanilla - No set selected.
Dictates how the the main UI looks like.
The selected mention style will dictate which icons are used for the icons in text. May require a game restart.
The selected mention style will dictate which icons are used for the icons in text. May require a game restart.
Only icons from the selected faction will appear in vanilla games.
Only icons from the selected faction will appear in btos2 games.
The chance of a different than normal icon appearing for roles.
Toggles whether all of the previously selected icon pack's easter eggs will be used, or only the selected icon pack's.
Enable Easter Eggs In Player Panel
Toggles whether easter egg icons appear or not in the ability panel.
Dictates how long should one iteration of an animation last for.
Dictates how the fire of the main UI looks like.
Dictates how dark or light the fire color will be.
Dictates how the paper of the main UI looks like.
Dictates how dark or light the paper color will be.
Dictates how the metal of the main UI looks like.
Dictates how dark or light the metal color will be.
Dictates how the leather of the main UI looks like.
Dictates how dark or light the leather color will be.
Dictates how the wax of the main UI looks like.
Dictates how dark or light the wax color will be.
Dictates how the wood of the main UI looks like.
Dictates how dark or light the wood color will be.
Dictates if fire should be affected by Faction UI. If disabled, fire will use the color from Custom UI.
Dictates if paper should be affected by Faction UI. If disabled, paper will use the color from Custom UI.
Dictates if metal should be affected by Faction UI. If disabled, metal will use the color from Custom UI.
Dictates if leather should be affected by Faction UI. If disabled, leather will use the color from Custom UI.
Dictates if wax should be affected by Faction UI. If disabled, wax will use the color from Custom UI.
Dictates if wood should be affected by Faction UI. If disabled, wood will use the color from Custom UI.
Makes the musicians that play the trumpets remember they can play more than one note.
The text that is shown in the role card when the player is recruited by the Jackal.
The text that is shown when a Town role is recruited by the Jackal.
The text that is shown when a Coven role is recruited by the Jackal.
The text that is shown when an Apocalypse role is recruited by the Jackal.
The text that is shown when the Serial Killer is recruited by the Jackal.
The text that is shown when the Arsonist is recruited by the Jackal.
The text that is shown when the Werewolf is recruited by the Jackal.
The text that is shown when the Shroud is recruited by the Jackal.
The text that is shown when a Pandora role is recruited by the Jackal.
The text that is shown when a Compliance role is recruited by the Jackal.
The text that is shown when the Cursed Soul is recruited by the Jackal.
The text that is shown in the role card when the player is a Town Traitor.
The text that is shown in the role card when the player is a Coven Town Traitor.
The text that is shown in the role card when the player is an Apocalypse Town Traitor.
The text that is shown in the role card when the player is a Pandora Town Traitor.
The text that is shown in the role card when the player is VIP.
The text that is shown in chat during court when the Judge speaks (BetterTOS2 Games Only).
The text that is shown in chat during court when anyone other than the Judge speaks (BetterTOS2 Games Only).
The color of the text that is shown in chat during court when anyone other than the Judge speaks (BetterTOS2 Games Only).
The color of chat messages sent by the Judge during Court (BetterTOS2 Games Only).
The color of chat messages sent by the Jailor while in Jail.
The color of chat messages sent by the Pirate while being dueled by a Pirate (BetterTOS2 Games Only).
Toggles various text making use of a more dynamic set of text (But secretly, you are a Jailor).
The text that is shown in chat at night when being dueled by the Pirate (BetterTOS2 Games Only).
The primary color for the blue part of buckets.
The secondary color for the blue part of buckets.
The primary color for the Any bucket.
The secondary color for the Any bucket.
The primary color for achievement keywords.
The secondary color for achievement keywords.
The primary color for the Neutral part of Neutral buckets.
The secondary color for the Neutral part of Neutral buckets.
The primary color for the Town faction.
The secondary color for the Town faction.
The major ending color for the Town faction.
The lethal ending color for the Town faction.
The horseman ending color for the Town faction.

The primary color for the Compliance faction.
The middle color for the Compliance faction. This setting does nothing if Vertical Gradients is active!
The secondary color for the Compliance faction.
The major ending color for the Compliance faction.
The horseman ending color for the Compliance faction.
The primary color for the Frogs faction.

The primary color for the Jester faction.

The primary color for the Executioner faction.
The secondary color for the Executioner faction.
The primary color for the Doomsayer faction.
The secondary color for the Doomsayer faction.
The primary color for the Pirate faction.
The secondary color for the Pirate faction.
The primary color for the Inquisitor faction.
The secondary color for the Inquisitor faction.
The primary color for the Starspawn faction.
The secondary color for the Starspawn faction.
The primary color for the Judge faction.
The secondary color for the Judge faction.
The primary color for the Auditor faction.
The secondary color for the Auditor faction.
The Neutral color used in the Neutral role buckets.
The color for Stoned and Hidden.
The primary color used when Lovers win.
The secondary color used when Lovers win.
Toggles whether game sprite sheets are dumped so pack debugging is possible.
Toggles whether the mod dumps info on loaded packs.
Changing this value changes the name text below to appear when mentioning the same number.
When you are jailed by the Jailor, this option makes the old jailor overlay appear on your screen.
When you are jailing someone as the Jailor, this option makes the old jailor overlay appear on your screen.
Shows the character head shot and role icon at their respective locations during the role reveal cinematic.
Modifies the testing UI as per the selected faction as if you were that faction in game.
Modifies the testing UI as per the selected role as if you were that role in game.
How effective is the custom color (0 = Custom color is additive, 100 = Custom color replaces, 50 = Mix of both 0 and 100 values).
How bright do all forms of custom color appear on the UI.
Filters the color settings for easier browsing.
Changes which testing display is currently visible.
<wave a=1>%name% has revealed themself as The %name_role11%!
%name% has revealed themself as the %name_role55% and started a Tribunal!
%name% has revealed themself as the %name_role56% and started a Tribunal!
Name Of The %type% GitHub Repository (Defaults To: RoleIconRecolors)
Name Of The %type% GitHub Repository Owner (Defaults To: AlchlcDvl)
Name Of The %type% GitHub Repository Branch It Is In (Defaults To: main)
Confirm Link Parameters And Generate Link
The color of whispers when you are Wildling.
The color of whispers when you are Serial Killer in BetterTOS2.
The color of player names in chat when their role is unknown.
The color of player names in dead chat.
The opacity of the chat background. Default is 80%.
The size of the faction label in the role card. Also applies to the VIP, Town Traitor and Recruited labels. Default is 85%.
Render Role Icon in Player List
Whether or not to render the role icon in the player list, either to the left or to the right.
The <sprite="RoleIcons" name="Role26">%name_role26% would like to retrain you into %role%.
You are Doomed. Do you wish to live or to die?
<shake a=0.3>%name_role253% has claimed the souls of the %name_faction1%!</shake>
The %name_role43% has appeased the Old Ones.
<shake a=0.3>You were killed by a member of the %name_faction2%!</shake>

You are an acolyte of <shake a=0.3><sprite="RoleIcons" name="Role250"><style=ApocalypseColor>%name_role250%</style></shake>, destroying the town's food supply.
